thread.title: GO Airport Express Launches Tours for Sports Fans
thread.title_full: GO Airport Express Launches Tours for Sports Fans - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: GO Airport Express Launches Tours for Sports Fans
text:
GO Airport Express
CHICAGO , Sept. 1, Sports enthusiasts wanting to snap selfies in front of their favorite Chicago sports venues have a new, fun and convenient way to get to all of the sites in one tour.
GO Airport Express , a Chicago -based ground transportation provider, has launched a new tour, taking passengers to the top sports stops for just $39 per person. Fans will be picked up at their downtown Chicago hotel (or other downtown site) and shuttled to historic Wrigley Field , built in 1914; the United Center, home of the Chicago Bulls and Blackhawks; plus Soldier Field and US Cellular ballpark. Tours will end at Harry Caray's Water Tower with admission to the Chicagoland Sports Hall of Fame.
Passengers have about 10 to 15 minutes to explore the outside of the parks before moving to the next destination.
"Visitors won't have to worry about directions, parking or gas to see these five great spots," Ron Hann , vice president, sales and marketing, GO Airport Express . "Plus, they can swap stories and share the fun with other sports-loving passengers."
One of the oldest companies in Chicago , GO Airport Express, which serves O'Hare and Midway airports, traces its founding to 1853 and the Parmelee Transportation Company, which provided a carriage service between Chicago's railroad stations and the downtown hotels. It is a founding member of The GO Group LLC, the nation's largest airport transportation provider, serving airports in North America , Mexico , the Caribbean and Europe and transporting more than 13 million passengers per year. For more information, visit www.airportexpress.com .
